summary: This document is an external consultant review of the medical care provided to Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York prior to his death by hanging/suicide. It identifies several process failures, including incomplete tracking of ordered tests, incomplete AED inspection documentation, and a recommendation to include Health Services staff on psychological review committees. It concludes no medical issues contributed to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died by hanging/suicide at MCC New York; the subject of the medical review.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by hanging/suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: Epstein's Admission to MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was admitted to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: History and Physical Examination
events.description: A History and Physical examination was performed on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC, within the required 14-day policy window.

events.title: Chronic Care Clinic Visit
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was seen at the Chronic Care clinic at MCC.

keyFacts: The external medical review concluded that no medical issues contributed to Jeffrey Epstein's death by hanging/suicide.
The review identified a failure to track results for an EKG and other tests ordered for Epstein upon his admission on July 6, 2019.
Documentation for Automated External Defibrillator (AED) inspections at the institution was often incomplete, which is critical life-support equipment.
The consultant clarified that Epstein's History and Physical exam on July 9, 2019, was completed within the BOP's required 14-day policy from his July 6 admission.
The consultant reiterated a prior recommendation to add a Health Services staff member to the committee that conducts Psychological Reconstruction Reviews.
